page.title: 14Housing
page.content: The few very old houses in Cookridge are over two hundred years old. They are made of stone with slate roofs. The farmhouse is now an inn, the old smithy a house and the gamekeeper's cottage a house. The 18th century Cookridge Hall is now a nursing home. In the 1920's a few houses were built along the existing roads. Cookridge began to expand in 1952 when new estates were built, first at Tinshill, where the different kinds of houses ranged from 3 storey flats to private bungalows and houses. In 1957 the Moseley Woods were built. The biggest new estate, Holt Park, was built in 1973. It consists of houses, shops, a library and a sports centre. The newest houses were built at Cookridge Towers in 1982. These are very modern, smaller and brighter looking because they are made of yellow bricks.
